main_definition: To challenge someone to do something that is difficult, risky or potentially against their will.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To have the courage to do something bold or challenging
meanings_and_examples.example: I dare you to jump into the lake on a freezing winter day.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A challenge issued by someone that encourages another person to undertake a difficult task
meanings_and_examples.example: She dared him to climb Mount Everest without any professional training.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To tempt or provoke someone to do something risky or unwise
meanings_and_examples.example: His constant taunting dared her to steal from the store.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A dare is a game played between friends, involving challenges that are usually bold and potentially dangerous
meanings_and_examples.example: The group of teenagers decided to play truth or dare, with one person daring another to skydive.
